I’m comfortable calling Portal 2 a timeless classic. It’s one of those lightning-in-a-bottle video games that came out at a unique time and helped define a moment in gaming.

If you’re somehow under a rock and have never played the Portal series, it is definitely worth playing the prequel before this, but that prequel lasts about three hours at best. You don’t need to, though, and can dive in straight here if you’re feeling saucy.

The moment-to-moment gameplay is punctuated by well written humor alongside Valve’s excellent pacing, and it all comes together in a notoriously awesome package. It’s tough to say anything bad about Portal 2, even years later it still plays well, and I honestly can’t think of a negative for this game. I guess it doesn’t alt-tab cleanly, it’s from that ugly build of source, but that’s about it.

Alongside the singleplayer, there’s a cooperative mode with a unique campaign storyline, and you can download maps and campaigns off the steam workshop to play through. The coop campaign is, indeed, a canon story, and worth checking out if you can find a friend to play with. Workshop maps vary in quality, as is expected.

This game is amazing. I've played through the entire single-player story in about 6 hours and i fell in love. I must say that i love the taunting from GlaDos, it really pulls the character together. The history you find out about her is really nice too. Wheatley is really nice too, i think Stephen merchant was a really good choice in voice actor. Both characters are really well put together and i was never left thinking they were just 2D throw away characters.The level designs are really well put together and original for the most part. The levels need creative thinking but don't demand too much. It's a very good line between difficult yet accomplishable. (I haven't played portal one yet so i don't know if they recycled much) The ending is really cool too and uses a lot of cool mechanics and requires a little creativity. There's a song at the end, its really good. This game overall left me with a feeling of satisfaction and accomplishment, which i really haven't felt with too many games in recent times. This game deserves your time even if you aren't much of a puzzle person.

[h1]Final Verdict: Buy! [/h1]

Well, I bought this (along with Portal 1) back in July of 2012 on a Steam summer sale. It only took me 8 years to finally complete this game. I think I enjoyed Portal 1 more, but I only played the single player mode for this game. I never got a chance to play co-op, mostly because I'm kind of anti-social. That was part of the reason for the delay. Kept thinking I'd have a nerdy gf to play this with someday. Well, now with Covid-19 and social distancing, there's no better time to forget couch co-op and just play single player mode!

Still, the single player mode was challenging. I really had to rack my brains for a few of the puzzles. I especially liked the cinematic scenes where you still used the logic from the regular puzzle problems in the outside world. It was a nice break from the normal puzzles and kept the game from getting stale. 

I enjoyed the story. I think this story was better overall than Portal 1. I definitely had no idea where it going. It has the same type of humor from the first. It took me 14 hours to complete the game. However, a lot of that was spent experimenting with different injectors because I did want to play this game in VR (but never found a satisfactory solution). 

After playing Portal Stories, I wish this game did have a VR mod. I don't play too many pancake games, but this is a classic. If you enjoy puzzle games, this is a must buy. Even if you don't enjoy puzzle games, this game may change your mind.

[b]Rate 9/10. It's a classic. It might even get you to like puzzle games, that's how good it is.[/b]

If you've never played this classic game, I couldn't recommend it enough. One of the most interesting mechanics in any game ever. Best puzzle game of all time. Graphics hold up very well, the writing is still sharp to this day, the voice acting is top notch, and the game design is otherworldly. One of the best single-player experiences I have ever had. And recently I have started playing the multiplayer with a friend of mine and it really doesn't get better than this. Play this game.
Excellent job Valve! 9.5/10

Portal es un clásico de los juegos de puzles en primera persona, que ha subido muy alto el listón a muchos otros juegos. Portal 2 no sólo ha superado el listón dejado por su antecesor, si no que lo ha superado (y eso que aún no he jugado multijugador).

La historia es bastante más larga, los escenarios más detallados y dinámicos, algunos de los puzles suponen un reto interesante (aunque muchos otros no suponen reto alguno) y hay un par de giros inesperados en los acontecimientos.

Es un juego muy antiguo (tiene 9 años cuando escribo estas líneas), pero aún así ha envejecido incluso mejor que Portal (que teniendo casi 13 años también ha envejecido muy bien).

Aunque me pasé este juego jugándolo "pirata", me lo he comprado y terminado de nuevo. También he invitado a mi hija a probarlo una hora. He jugado tanto en local como en Geforce Now.

Pues eso, que si no tienes este juego en tu biblioteca, no dudes en comprarlo... sobre todo si está de oferta :)

Portal 2 est aussi bien que le 1, il est même mieux. Sa durée de vie est beaucoup plus longue et comme dans le 1, certains niveaux sont à s'arracher les cheveux. Mais le plaisir de jouer est malgré tout présent. Les salles de test sont très bien faites.
L'histoire et la narration de la voix off est tordante par moments, et la fin est superbe. J'ai suivi les avis extrêmement positifs, j'ai acheté le bundle et je ne le regrette absolument pas. Je vous le recommande fortement.
